appg_groups.name: Africa
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Africa
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate mutually beneficial relationships between Africa and the UK and to further understanding within the UK parliament of contemporary UK-African relations and pan-African matters and development agendas in the UK parliament. The group also seeks to challenge negative stereotypes pertaining to Africa where they persist.

appg_groups.name: Albania
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Albania
appg_groups.purpose: To help bilateral relations between the UK and Albania and improve parliamentary relations.

appg_groups.name: Angola
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Angola
appg_groups.purpose: To build a greater understanding in parliament of Angola and its regional and international roles; to build links and foster good relations with Angola; and to support development and democracy in Angola.

appg_groups.name: Argentina
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Argentina
appg_groups.purpose: To maintain relations between the two countries and to build links with the Argentine Congress.

appg_groups.name: Australia and New Zealand
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Australia and New Zealand
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage political interest in Australia and New Zealand (ANZAC); to meet with ANZAC politicians who are visiting the UK; to meet with the High Commissioners of Australia and New Zealand; and to discuss Australian, New Zealand and UK politics.

appg_groups.name: Azerbaijan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Azerbaijan
appg_groups.purpose: To develop good relations between the legislatures and governments of our two countries.

appg_groups.name: Bangladesh
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Bangladesh
appg_groups.purpose: To further understanding of the role of philanthropy, giving and social investment in parliament, and to act as a discussion forum for politicians, philanthropists, social investors and experts to develop policy to improve and increase the amount of giving and social investment to good causes in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Belarus
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Belarus
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and strengthen relations between the parliaments of Belarus and UK.

appg_groups.name: Belize
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Belize
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between the UK and Belize.

appg_groups.name: Bermuda
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Bermuda
appg_groups.purpose: To improve links and mutual understanding between Britain and Bermuda.

appg_groups.name: Democracy in Burma
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Democracy in Burma
appg_groups.purpose: To provide democratic change in Burma.

appg_groups.name: Catalonia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Catalonia
appg_groups.purpose: To develop links between parliamentarians in this country and in Catalonia. To keep Members of Parliament abreast of the ongoing events and debates about Catalan self-determination and to help ensure that debate is carried out in the most democratic way.

appg_groups.name: the Cayman Islands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Cayman Islands
appg_groups.purpose: To maintain links with and develop an understanding of the Cayman Islands.

appg_groups.name: Chile
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Chile
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between parliamentarians from the UK and Chile and to increase knowledge and understanding of Chile.

appg_groups.name: Colombia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Colombia
appg_groups.purpose: To foster and promote relations between the UK and Colombia and to assist in raising awareness amongst parliamentarians and the public of the developments that have been taking place in Colombia.

appg_groups.name: the Commonwealth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Commonwealth
appg_groups.purpose: To inform Members about the Commonwealth Secretariat's developments to strengthen the Commonwealth network; to keep members aware of the range of non-parliamentary activities and programmes carried out underneath the Commonwealth brand, both on governmental and non-governmental levels; and to take advantage of opportunities within the developing Commonwealth network for Britain's political and commercial activities and for Britain's positioning in the new international landscape.

appg_groups.name: Cyprus
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Cyprus
appg_groups.purpose: To promote positive relations between the UK and the Republic of Cyprus and their elected parliamentarians and people.

appg_groups.name: Egypt
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Egypt
appg_groups.purpose: To strengthen relations between British and Egyptian parliamentarians and promote British-Egyptian relations amongst both chambers of the UK Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Eritrea
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eritrea
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the human rights abuses that are taking place in Eritrea; to examine and debate how the human rights situation in the country might be improved; and to raise matters of concern with, and make representations to, government and other policy makers.

appg_groups.name: Estonia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Estonia
appg_groups.purpose: To promote good relations between Britain and Estonia and specifically to facilitate contact between parliamentarians and other representative bodies in both countries.

appg_groups.name: Ethiopia and Djibouti
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ethiopia and Djibouti
appg_groups.purpose: To promote knowledge of, and interest in, Ethiopia and Djibouti; to maintain good relations with those countries; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: France
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on France
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between both Houses of Parliament and the Assemblée National and Sénat in Paris.

appg_groups.name: Friends of Syria
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Friends of Syria
appg_groups.purpose: A form for MPs and Peers interested in Syria.

appg_groups.name: Georgia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Georgia
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate greater parliamentary awareness on developments in Georgia.

appg_groups.name: Gibraltar
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Gibraltar
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between both countries.

appg_groups.name: Hong Kong
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hong Kong
appg_groups.purpose: To promote democracy and the rule of law, and to defend human rights in Hong Kong, to share information about Hong Kong, and to nurture relations between the United Kingdom and the people of Hong Kong.

appg_groups.name: Hungary
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hungary
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between both countries.

appg_groups.name: Ireland and the Irish in Britain
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ireland and the Irish in Britain
appg_groups.purpose: To promote good relations between Ireland and the UK, foster understanding of issues affecting the British-Irish relationship; celebrate links between both countries and their people; and represent and raise issues affecting the Irish community in Britain.

appg_groups.name: Italy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Italy
appg_groups.purpose: Furthering relations between the British Parliament and the Italian Parliament and all related activities to enhance the relationship between the UK and Italy.

appg_groups.name: Japan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Japan
appg_groups.purpose: To develop and improve links between the British and Japanese parliaments and encourage a deeper understanding of their respective cultures. The APPG also has an important role to play in promoting trade between the two countries.

appg_groups.name: Kazakhstan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Kazakhstan
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between the UK and Kazakhstan.

appg_groups.name: Kosovo
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Kosovo
appg_groups.purpose: To help bilateral relations between the UK and Kosovo and improve parliamentary relations.

appg_groups.name: the Kurdistan Region in Iraq
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Kurdistan Region in Iraq
appg_groups.purpose: To promote friendship and understanding between the peoples and representatives of the Kurdistan Region in Iraq and the UK.

appg_groups.name: Kyrgyzstan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Kyrgyzstan
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between the UK and Kyrgyzstan.

appg_groups.name: Latin America
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Latin America
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations between parliamentarians from Britain and parliamentarians from Latin American countries.

appg_groups.name: Lebanon
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Lebanon
appg_groups.purpose: To strengthen political and economic relationships between the United Kingdom and Lebanon.

appg_groups.name: Lithuania
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Lithuania
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and strengthen relations between the parliaments of Lithuania and the UK.

appg_groups.name: Malawi
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malawi
appg_groups.purpose: To promote understanding and awareness among parliamentarians; support positive relations between our countries; and provide a forum for discussion on relevant issues affecting politics, society, culture and the economy in Malawi.

appg_groups.name: Malta
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Malta
appg_groups.purpose: To foster good relations and develop greater understanding of the island of Malta and Maltese nationals living in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Mexico
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mexico
appg_groups.purpose: To keep Mexico on the political agenda of the UK parliament, and to strengthen bilateral relations.

appg_groups.name: Moldova
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Moldova
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and strengthen relations between the parliaments of Moldova and the UK.

appg_groups.name: Morocco
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Morocco
appg_groups.purpose: To promote good relations between the United Kingdom and the Kingdom of Morocco, particularly the respective parliamentary assemblies, within the framework of the Inter-Parliamentary Union.

appg_groups.name: Nigeria
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nigeria
appg_groups.purpose: To create a better understanding of issues relating to Nigeria; to promote links between the UK and Nigeria; and to support development and democracy in Nigeria.

appg_groups.name: North Korea
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on North Korea
appg_groups.purpose: To formulate solutions that promote and support human rights, democracy and security in the Democratic People's Republic of North Korea; to establish relations with the exiled North Korean community to foster understanding of the DPRK and the challenges which face its people; and to explore meaningful relations between the parliaments of the UK and the DPRK.

appg_groups.name: North Macedonia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for North Macedonia
appg_groups.purpose: To help bilateral relations between the UK and North Macedonia and improve parliamentary relations.

appg_groups.name: Pakistan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pakistan
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss all matters related to Pakistan and also pertinent issues related to Pakistanis living in the UK.

appg_groups.name: the Philippines
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Philippines
appg_groups.purpose: To foster relations between the United Kingdom and the Philippines.

appg_groups.name: Poland
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Poland
appg_groups.purpose: To foster a good relationship between Poland and the UK and to promote the contribution of the Polish community to the UK and bilateral trade.

appg_groups.name: the Polar Regions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Polar Regions
appg_groups.purpose: Informing MPs and Peers about topical issues affecting the Arctic and Antarctic.

appg_groups.name: Romania
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Romania
appg_groups.purpose: To promote better relations between the UK and Romania and between their parliaments.

appg_groups.name: Russia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Russia
appg_groups.purpose: To promote good relations between the parliaments and peoples of the UK and the Russia.

appg_groups.name: Rwanda
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rwanda
appg_groups.purpose: This group focuses on Rwanda and UK Rwandese relations

appg_groups.name: Saudi Arabia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Saudi Arabia
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage and develop diplomatic, cultural and social exchanges between the Royal Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and the UK with the aim of achieving greater understanding and fostering mutual respect.

appg_groups.name: Singapore
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Singapore
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and advance relations with Singapore.

appg_groups.name: Somaliland
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Somaliland
appg_groups.purpose: To promote understanding of and support for Somaliland's achievements in building peace, democratic governance and a sovereign state in the Horn of Africa, its important role in combatting terrorism and piracy in the region and beyond, and the need for continued UK assistance for Somaliland's development.

appg_groups.name: the Association of South East Asian Nations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Association of South East Asian Nations
appg_groups.purpose: To promote relations between parliament and the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN); to raise awareness of the progress and ambition of ASEAN; and to encourage engagement between the UK and ASEAN.

appg_groups.name: Sri Lanka
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sri Lanka
appg_groups.purpose: To further Anglo-Sri Lankan relations.

appg_groups.name: Sudan and South Sudan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sudan and South Sudan
appg_groups.purpose: To influence the UK government's policy and practice by promoting the cause of peace, human rights, justice and development for all the people of Sudan and South Sudan across the political spectrum in Westminster and Whitehall.

appg_groups.name: Thailand
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Thailand
appg_groups.purpose: To maintain links with and develop an understanding of Thailand, its culture and politics.

appg_groups.name: Tibet
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tibet
appg_groups.purpose: To put pressure on Her Majesty's Government to encourage negotiations between the Chinese Government and representatives of the Tibetan Government in exile, whilst recognising that Tibet is an occupied country which had independent ties with Britain.

appg_groups.name: Turkey
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Turkey
appg_groups.purpose: To foster and promote relations between the UK and Turkey and to assist in raising awareness amongst parliamentarians and the public of the developments that have been taking place in Turkey.

appg_groups.name: the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interest of the people of Northern Cyprus.

appg_groups.name: Ukraine
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ukraine
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and strengthen relations between the UK and Ukrainian parliaments.

appg_groups.name: Uzbekistan
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Uzbekistan
appg_groups.purpose: To develop good relations between the people, legislatures and governments of our two countries.

appg_groups.name: Venezuela
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Venezuela
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that Venezuela is on the political agenda of the UK Parliament and

appg_groups.name: Vietnam
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Vietnam
appg_groups.purpose: To conduct a dialogue with the socialist republic of Vietnam, in particular with the Vietnamese National Assembly and the Vietnamese ambassador and embassy in London, and to take an interest in the Vietnamese community in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Western Sahara
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Western Sahara
appg_groups.purpose: To promote issues of mutual concern between British MPs and the Western Sahara, and ensure the subject is never far from the political agenda of the UK Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Yemen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Yemen
appg_groups.purpose: To educate parliamentarians about Yemen and to influence the UK government's policy and practice by promoting the cause of peace, human rights, justice and development for all the people of Yemen.

appg_groups.name: Zimbabwe
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Zimbabwe
appg_groups.purpose: To support democratic governance in Zimbabwe and to foster good relations between Zimbabwe and the UK.

appg_groups.name: on 22q11 Syndrome
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on on 22q11 Syndrome
appg_groups.purpose: To increase recognition and understanding of the Syndrome across policy makers and the medical profession. Eventually aiming for, once diagnosed, life-long health strategy for sufferers.

appg_groups.name: Acquired Brain Injury
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Acquired Brain Injury
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) and seek improvements in support and services for people with ABI and their carers; to provide a voice for people with ABI in parliament; and to raise issues across health, social care and welfare which affect people living with ABI.

appg_groups.name: Adult Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Adult Education
appg_groups.purpose: To celebrate the contribution of adult education to the social, economic and cultural wellbeing of the UK and to raise the profile of adult education through exploring the need for policy change and developing new evidence to demonstrate its impact.

appg_groups.name: Adult Social Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Adult Social Care
appg_groups.purpose: To act as a forum for members of the House of Commons and Lords to enagage with the wider adult social care sector, with the aim of engaging in a cross-party and non-partisan manner to influence government policy on the reform of the adult social care system.

appg_groups.name: the Prevention of Adverse Childhood Experiences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Prevention of Adverse Childhood Experiences
appg_groups.purpose: The prevention, recognition, understanding and healing of adverse childhood experiences.

appg_groups.name: Aerospace
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Aerospace
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness of all aspects of the British Aerospace sector in parliament and government.

appg_groups.name: Ageing and Older People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ageing and Older People
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum in which to hold the government to account on issues affecting ageing older people.

appg_groups.name: Agroecology for Sustainable Food and Farming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Agroecology for Sustainable Food and Farming
appg_groups.purpose: Providing a forum for parliamentarians, leading academics, farmers and NGOs to discuss the economic, social and environmental benefits of agroecological approaches to food and farming.

appg_groups.name: the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community
appg_groups.purpose: Seeks to make all parliamentarians aware of the extensive positive work done by the Ahmadiyya community and speak up on issues of persecution and extremism that Ahmadiyya muslims face abroad and in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Air Passenger Duty Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Air Passenger Duty Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage the UK government to cut the UK's Air Passenger Duty rate, thereby allowing the UK to compete on a level playing field with our European counterparts, boosting tourism, trade, jobs and growth.

appg_groups.name: Air Pollution
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Air Pollution
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians, experts, and stakeholders to discuss and promote measures to tackle poor air quality; and to work to raise the profile of both the problem and its solutions in Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Allergy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Allergy
appg_groups.purpose: To improve the lives of all people living with allergy across the UK; to improve National Health Service allergy services and allow greater access to existing services; to raise awareness of the condition, severity and prevalence and encourage greater understanding.

appg_groups.name: Alternative Dispute Resolution
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Alternative Dispute Resolution
appg_groups.purpose: To help change the culture of dispute resolution in the country by providing a valuable forum within Parliament to discuss the latest developments in Alternative Dispute Resolution and to promote its wider use.

appg_groups.name: Alternative Investment Management
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Alternative Investment Management
appg_groups.purpose: Raising awareness of the sector and its contribution to the UK economy; providing a forum to discuss development in investment strategy and the corresponding impact on UK pension endowments and direct lending; supporting the development of an effective and proportionate UK regulatory regime governing the industry.

appg_groups.name: Alternative Lending
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Alternative Lending
appg_groups.purpose: To help legislators keep pace with a rapidly evolving sector, and help them understand the effects of change both on employers and consumers. To provide a forum where MPs and peers can talk to lenders and ensure the market develops in harmony with policy.

appg_groups.name: American Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for American Football
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of American football.

appg_groups.name: Animal Welfare
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Animal Welfare
appg_groups.purpose: To use the influence of experts and politicians to raise awareness of animal welfare issues and to develop solutions through evidence based inquiries and policy development.

appg_groups.name: Against Antisemitism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group Against Antisemitism
appg_groups.purpose: To combat antisemitism and help develop and seek implementation of effective public policy to combat antisemitism.

appg_groups.name: Apprenticeships
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Apprenticeships
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and employers to discuss how to promote the role of high quality apprenticeships.

appg_groups.name: the Armed Forces
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Armed Forces
appg_groups.purpose: To promote better understanding of Her Majesty's Armed Forces in Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Art Craft and Design in Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Art, Craft and Design in Education
appg_groups.purpose: The group believes that art, craft and design education is essential to the economy and to the cultural, spiritual, creative and social wellbeing of all; that it empowers individuals, enabling them to engage with our rich visual and cultural heritage, express themselves and become visually literate and perceptive, and that access to high quality art, craft and design education is an entitlement for everyone.

appg_groups.name: Artificial Intelligence
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Artificial Intelligence
appg_groups.purpose: To address the economic, social and ethical implications of developing and implementing Artificial Intelligence (including machine learning, natural language understanding, automated reasoning, autonomous systems etc).

appg_groups.name: Assistive Technology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Assistive Technology
appg_groups.purpose: To disseminate knowledge, generate debate and facilitate engagement on assistive technology amongst members of both Houses of Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Attention Deficit Hyperactive Disorder (ADHD) and its impact on those with the condition. To help bring positive change to the lives of people living with ADHD. To share ideas, and act as a link between parliament and organisations and charities involved with this issue.

appg_groups.name: Autism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Autism
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of issues affecting autistic people, their families and carers; to raise parliamentary awareness of autism; to campaign for changes to government policy to benefit autistic people and improve diagnosis or support for autistic people.

appg_groups.name: Axial Spondyloarthritis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Axial Spondyloarthritis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Axial Spondyloarthritis, including Ankylosing Spondylitis, and strive for improved outcomes for all those who are affected by the condition.

appg_groups.name: Baby Loss
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Baby Loss
appg_groups.purpose: To develop policy that supports families dealing with the grief and loss of a baby, and to raise awareness of what more can be done by the government, Parliament or other agencies to help those affected.

appg_groups.name: the Baháí Faith
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Bahá'í Faith
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness on the Bahá'í faith and the efforts of the Bahá'í community to contribute to British society, and to seek action in respect of the persecution of Bahá'ís in Iran and other instances where Bahá'ís are subject to discrimination on the grounds of their faith.

benefits_details.source: The Office of Public Affairs Secretariat 1,501-3,000 25/02/2020 05/03/2020

appg_groups.name: Baseball and Softball
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Baseball and Softball
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of baseball and softball at all levels.

appg_groups.name: Basketball
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Basketball
appg_groups.purpose: To promote participation in and the development of the sport of basketball at all levels in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Beauty Aesthetics and Wellbeing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Beauty, Aesthetics and Wellbeing
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentary discussions on the issues around beauty, aesthetics and wellbeing. To support the beauty and aesthetics industry, celebrate its economic and social contribution and discuss the challenges it faces, particularly the need for improved standards around non- surgical cosmetic procedures.

appg_groups.name: the Black Country Economy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Black Country Economy
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise and address the economic barriers to growth that the region faces, promoting its significance as a sub-region and raising its importance to key stakeholders.

appg_groups.name: Black Asian and Minority Ethnic Business Owners
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic Business Owners
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians from all parties and both Houses with key players in Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) businesses to promote the growth of successful BAME businesses across the UK. A key aim is to promote an inclusive national strategy of policy, support and resources to enable the growth of BAME owned businesses for the benefit of the overall UK economy.

appg_groups.name: Bladder and Bowel Continence Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Bladder and Bowel Continence Care
appg_groups.purpose: To break the taboo by raising awareness of bladder and bowel continence for adults and children and to promote cost effective funding for assessment, treatment and appropriate product provision.

appg_groups.name: Blockchain
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Blockchain
appg_groups.purpose: Ensuring industry and society benefit from the full potential of blockchain and other distributed ledger technologies (DLT).

appg_groups.name: Blood Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Blood Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of blood cancer patients with parliamentarians, government, NHS and charity stakeholders, and to create a forum for broader issues affecting blood cancer patients.

appg_groups.name: Boxing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Boxing
appg_groups.purpose: To engage with government and parliament to support all aspects of boxing. To set out the benefits of boxing to individuals and wider society; reduce the barriers to participation in boxing; celebrate the success of our nation’s boxers; and highlight the potential for boxing to tackle urgent social needs in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Brain Tumours
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Brain Tumours
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the issues facing the brain tumour community in order to improve research, diagnosis, information, support, treatment and care outcomes.

appg_groups.name: Breast Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Breast Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: Raises the profile of breast cancer issues within parliament. Provides a forum for MPs and Peers to discuss important issues affecting patients with breast cancer. Encourages dialogue between parliamentarians, government, the NHS and those living with or affected by the disease.

appg_groups.name: Bridge
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Bridge
appg_groups.purpose: To develop awareness of the benefits of bridge, with particular reference to the ways in which it can develop skills in young people, and help those who are retired or about to retire.

appg_groups.name: British Bioethanol
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Bioethanol
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the industry, its economic impact, the supporting role it plays for British agriculture, and the environmental benefits of the bioethanol it produces. To promote the introduction of E10 fuel in the UK, help provide information and provide a greater understanding amongst parliamentarians and consumers.

appg_groups.name: British Hindus
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for British Hindus
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the interests of British Hindus to Parliament; to encourage political parties in the UK to actively engage with the British Hindu community; to consider campaigns and issues on behalf of British Hindus; to press for more government engagement with the Hindu community; to highlight and acknowledge the exceptional and significant contribution of the British Hindu community in all walks of life.

appg_groups.name: British Jews
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Jews
appg_groups.purpose: To promote understanding of the aspirations and challenges of the UK's Jewish community, with topics including religious freedom, faith based education, welfare and social justice. To celebrate the culture, contribution and achievements of the UK's Jewish community.

benefits_details.source: Board of Deputies of British Secretariat 1,501-3,000 28/01/2020 10/02/2020

appg_groups.name: British Muslims
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on British Muslims
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliament and parliamentarians of, and harness their support for, the aspirations and challenges of British Muslim communities; to promote and celebrate their contributions; and to investigate the forms, manifestations and extent of prejudice, discrimination and hatred against Muslims in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Broadband and Digital Communication
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Broadband and Digital Communication
appg_groups.purpose: To further the rollout of broadband in rural and urban areas, and to look at digital communication across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Building Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Building Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the social value of placemaking and good design for communities. The group focuses on how to improve community involvement in infrastructure, housing and other developments, and seeks to highlight the benefits of an upfront and informed approach to growth in local areas.

appg_groups.name: Excellence in the Built Environment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Excellence in the Built Environment
appg_groups.purpose: The group conducts inquiries into topical issues relating to the built environment (including housing, infrastructure, office and retail building and landscape.

appg_groups.name: Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To keep cancer on the political agenda, monitor implementation of government initiatives, provide briefings to parliamentarians, and ensure policy-making is evidence-based and patient-centred.

appg_groups.name: Cannabis Harmful Effects on Developing Brains
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cannabis: Harmful Effects on Developing Brains
appg_groups.purpose: To inform members of both Houses of Parliament and, using sound scientific and medical evidence, to raise awareness and stimulate discussion about the impact of cannabis on developing brains.

appg_groups.name: Celtic Nations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Celtic Nations
appg_groups.purpose: To celebrate, promote and enhance the unique characteristics and history of the Celtic nations.

appg_groups.name: Ceramics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ceramics
appg_groups.purpose: To broaden the understanding of ceramic manufacturing in the UK among parliamentarians, to promote ceramic manufacturing as an asset within the UK economy, and to provide a forum for parliamentary discussion on the issues impacting the industry.

appg_groups.name: Challenger Banks and Building Societies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Challenger Banks and Building Societies
appg_groups.purpose: To review the regulations of the banking and financial sector and to promote fair competition, removing entry barriers and encouraging diversity of service.

appg_groups.name: Children
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Children
appg_groups.purpose: To raise greater awareness in the Houses of Parliament of aspects of the well- being of the nation's children aged 0-18 years, and our obligations under the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child; and to work with children, young people, children's organisations, and politicians from all sides, to promote first-class government policy for children.

appg_groups.name: Children Teenagers and Young Adults with Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Children, Teenagers and Young Adults with Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-party group of MPs and peers which aims to raise awareness of the issues affecting children, teenagers and young adults with cancer and their families in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Childrens Media and the Arts
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Children's Media and the Arts
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the issues around children's media and arts within a wide cultural, social and educational context, and support the provision of both as specified in Articles 17 and 31 of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child.

appg_groups.name: Choice at the End of Life
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Choice at the End of Life
appg_groups.purpose: To improve the experience of dying in the UK by promoting and expanding people's choices at the end of life. To promote a change in the law to allow the choice of assisted dying for terminally ill, mentally competent adults.

appg_groups.name: Classical Music
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Classical Music
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians who have an interest in and wish to further the appreciation of classical music; to act as an interface between British orchestras' on and off-stage activities, the wider classical music industry, including broadcasters and the recording industry, and key decision makers and opinion formers; and to look at the potential for establishing parliamentary classical music awards and promoting the supporting young musicians.

appg_groups.name: Coalfield Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Coalfield Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage the further economic, social and cultural development of the UK's former coalfield communities, by bringing together MPs, external stakeholders and others to develop credible proposals for further coalfields regeneration.

appg_groups.name: Coastal Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Coastal Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To look at coastal strategies on a cross-party basis and establish a framework for policy to help boost coastal communities across the United Kingdom

appg_groups.name: the Commonweatlth Games
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Commonweatlth Games
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the Commonwealth Games, and particularly the 2022 Commonwealth Games, from bid to legacy - including home nations, participating sports and athletes taking part in the games.

appg_groups.name: Compassionate Politics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Compassionate Politics
appg_groups.purpose: To put compassion, inclusion and cooperation at the heart of politics.

appg_groups.name: Complex Needs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Complex Needs
appg_groups.purpose: To give parliamentarians a greater understanding of the barriers faced by those with complex needs or dual diagnosis who may have to negotiate a number of issues (mental health, substance misuse issues) in their lives while often living in deprivation and lacking access to stable housing or meaningful daily activities.

appg_groups.name: Conception to Age Two - First 1001 Days
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Conception to Age Two - First 1001 Days
appg_groups.purpose: To promote a holistic approach to the antenatal and post-natal period, specifically with regards to the early years and infant mental health; to hold evidence-based enquiries into best practice for the 1001 critical days to help policymakers make informed decisions on provision in this period; and to uphold cross-party consensus for this age group.

appg_groups.name: Consumer Protection
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Consumer Protection
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a voice for ordinary retail consumers across a range of sectors in the UK economy; to raise awareness of issues, rights and obligations in the field of consumer protection with parliamentarians and the wider public.

appg_groups.name: Council Housing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Council Housing
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign to increase the number of council houses being built, as a central part of the solution to the housing crisis, and seek to represent the interests of council tenants in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Council of Sri Lankan Muslim Organisations UK
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Council of Sri Lankan Muslim Organisations UK
appg_groups.purpose: To support and take up issues raised by Council of Sri Lankan Muslim Organisations UK (COSMOS UK) relating to Sri Lankan Muslims; working toward protecting their rights while promoting peaceful coexistence and thereby ushering in a strong relationship between the peoples of the UK and Sri Lanka

appg_groups.name: Craft
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Craft
appg_groups.purpose: To enhance the understanding and promotion of craft in the UK, and to ensure that craft skills are supported and passed on to future generations.

appg_groups.name: Creative Diversity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Creative Diversity
appg_groups.purpose: To identify and tackle obstacles to diversity and inclusion in the creative sector, establish effective practices in recruiting, retaining and developing diverse talent and provide recommendations for industry and government.

appg_groups.name: Credit Unions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Credit Unions
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for discussing the work of credit unions and the need to secure a legislative and regulatory regime which will allow credit unions to scale up and provide inclusive financial services for many more people.

appg_groups.name: Cricket
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cricket
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the interests of cricket at all levels.

appg_groups.name: Critical Minerals
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Critical Minerals
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the UK's need for a secure, sustainable supply of critical minerals to deliver the nation's industrial strategy.

appg_groups.name: Cyber Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Cyber Security
appg_groups.purpose: To be a forum for cyber security briefings and discussion. To address developments in cyber security systems and techniques affecting consumers, business and its role in defence, the UK economy/society and the Critical National Infrastructure. To examine security, identity, regulation and fraud. To raise awareness and understanding for non-specialists.

appg_groups.name: Cycling and Walking
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Cycling and Walking
appg_groups.purpose: To champion cycling and walking in the context of the growing importance of all forms of active travel. Our main aim is to get more people cycling and walking in the UK, more often and more safely.

appg_groups.name: Dalits
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Dalits
appg_groups.purpose: To draw attention to the discrimination against Dalits (the former untouchables) wherever it occurs and support attempts to eliminate it.

appg_groups.name: Dark Skies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Dark Skies
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the importance of preserving our ability to see a dark sky at night; promote the adoption of dark sky friendly lighting and planning policies; protect existing UK Dark Sky reserves and support potential new

appg_groups.name: Darts
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Darts
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of darts and support its continued development, as well as to inform and educate members of both Houses of Parliament and the wider public about the contribution of the sport to personal development, communities and charitable causes.

appg_groups.name: Data Analytics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Data Analytics
appg_groups.purpose: To disseminate knowledge, generate debate and facilitate engagement on data analytics amongst Members of both Houses of Parliament.

appg_groups.name: the Abolition of the Death Penalty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Abolition of the Death Penalty
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign for the abolition of the death penalty in all circumstances and to raise awareness of death penalty cases.

appg_groups.name: Deaths Abroad Consular Services and Assistance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Deaths Abroad, Consular Services and Assistance
appg_groups.purpose: To improve Foreign and Commonwealth Office consular services and assistance, including the process for bereaved families who have had loved ones murdered abroad, die abroad in suspicious circumstances, missing abroad, or in jail abroad.

appg_groups.name: Debt and Personal Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Debt and Personal Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for MPs and peers to discuss debt and personal finance issues; to monitor legislative and other developments in this area; and to provide an opportunity for liaison between members and consumer organisations with an interest in these issues.

appg_groups.name: Deliberative Democracy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Deliberative Democracy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the understanding and spread of deliberative democracy, including the greater use of citizens assemblies, citizens conventions and citizens juries.

appg_groups.name: Dementia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dementia
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of dementia among parliamentarians and to influence legislation and policy making in order to improve the lives of people with dementia and their carers.

appg_groups.name: Democracy and Human Rights in the Gulf
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Democracy and Human Rights in the Gulf
appg_groups.purpose: To protect and promote human rights and democracy in Gulf countries.

appg_groups.name: Diabetes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Diabetes
appg_groups.purpose: MPs and peers with a special interest in the issue of diabetes. The APPG engages with parliamentarians, people living with diabetes, health professionals and experts to share information, hold events and to ensure diabetes remains high on the political agenda.

appg_groups.name: Digital Identity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Digital Identity
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Digital ID issues by providing a forum for briefings and

appg_groups.name: Digital Skills
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Digital Skills
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, educators and employers to promote the importance of digital skills and to encourage a greater understanding of digital skills for personal, educational and career development.

appg_groups.name: Disability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Disability
appg_groups.purpose: To work on all-party basis within Parliament for the interests of all disabled people, their families, friends and carers.

appg_groups.name: District Councils
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for District Councils
appg_groups.purpose: To work to promote the interests of district councils, support closer working with parliamentarians and to raise awareness of the opportunities for districts in shaping the evolving local government agenda.

appg_groups.name: Diversity and Inclusion in Science Technology Engineering and Maths
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Diversity and Inclusion in Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths
appg_groups.purpose: The All-Party Parliamentary Group on Diversity and Inclusion in Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths (STEM) aims to promote the inclusion and progression of people from diverse backgrounds in STEM, and to encourage government, parliamentarians, academics, businesses and other stakeholders to work towards a STEM sector that is representative of the population.

appg_groups.name: Perpetrators of Domestic Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Perpetrators of Domestic Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure MPs and Peers have access to information about (a) perpetrators of domestic violence and (b) what makes an effective and safe perpetrator programme. To link MPs and Peers with local programmes, in order to increase their understanding of the above.

appg_groups.name: Domestic Violence and Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Domestic Violence and Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To work towards the elimination of domestic violence and abuse, to highlight issues arising for survivors and specialist support services, and to contribute to the development of policy and legislation in this area.

appg_groups.name: Drones
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Drones
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the use of drones (unmanned aerial vehicles) by governments, for domestic and international, military and civilian purposes.

appg_groups.name: Drug Policy Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Drug Policy Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To enable debate about evidence-based drug policy reform that promotes the overall public good.

appg_groups.name: Dyslexia and Other Specific Learning Difficulties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dyslexia and Other Specific Learning Difficulties
appg_groups.purpose: To understand Dyslexia and other specific learning difficulties and the need to keep government appraised of the situation in schools, education and in general in the UK. The group will also look at what statutory and non- statutory bodies are achieving in this field. The aim is to achieve a dyslexia friendly society by enabling individuals with dyslexia to achieve their potential across all ages and sectors of society.

appg_groups.name: Dyspraxia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Dyspraxia
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Dyspraxia/DCD and Neuro diverse conditions and its impact on those with the condition. To share ideas, and act as a link between parliament and organisations and charities involved with this issue.

appg_groups.name: the East Coast Main Line
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the East Coast Main Line
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign on securing investment for one of the UK's most strategic rail routes; on improving passenger experience, capacity and reliability; and on shorter journey times - as well as on the economic growth that could be unlocked in the areas the East Coast Main Line serves.

appg_groups.name: the East Midlands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the East Midlands
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers from across the East Midlands region, in coordination with leaders in local government, commerce and civil society, to identify priorities for development and maximise future investment in the region, to the benefit of all its communities.

appg_groups.name: the East of England
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the East of England
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together east of England's MPs and Peers with elected local leaders - and the private and third sectors - to give a strong political voice for policies which support the east of England's economy and promote its potential as a place to work, study, live and invest.

appg_groups.name: Eating Disorders
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eating Disorders
appg_groups.purpose: To improve policy, in particular improving access and treatment for people affected by eating disorders and measures that support prevention and early intervention.

appg_groups.name: Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and stimulate debate across all sectors of education.

appg_groups.name: Eggs Pigs and Poultry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Eggs, Pigs and Poultry
appg_groups.purpose: To raise concern and interest for the egg, pig and poultry sectors.

appg_groups.name: Electoral Campaigning Transparency
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electoral Campaigning Transparency
appg_groups.purpose: To evaluate current UK electoral campaigning laws, interviewing experts and practitioners in the field, producing the evidence base for recommendations that ensure electoral campaigning laws are fit for purpose in the modern era. In reconstitution the APPG's aim is to secure those recommendations in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Electric Vehicles
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electric Vehicles
appg_groups.purpose: To engage parliamentarians interested in electric vehicles by considering issues relating to manufacturing, energy supply and infrastructure requirements amongst others. The group will also consider the impacts of automated vehicles and other forms of electric mobility by bringing together manufacturers, businesses and experts to promote awareness and debate future policy options.

appg_groups.name: Endometriosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Endometriosis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of endometriosis and investigate how those who suffer from the condition can receive the support they need.

appg_groups.name: Energy Costs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Energy Costs
appg_groups.purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion on all aspects of energy costs; to inform energy policy decisions and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Energy Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Security
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the security of energy supply in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Energy Studies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Studies
appg_groups.purpose: Informing the government of the day of the energy issues of the day.

appg_groups.name: Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage, support and promote entrepreneurship. Also ensures that parliament is kept up to date on what is needed to create and sustain the most favourable conditions for entrepreneurship.

appg_groups.name: Epilepsy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Epilepsy
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of epilepsy among parliamentarians and to engage with individuals and organisations in supporting the promotion of the needs of the epilepsy community.

appg_groups.name: Equipment for Disabled Children
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Equipment for Disabled Children
appg_groups.purpose: To remove barriers that prevent disabled and terminally ill children from receiving the right equipment at the right time. Working across parliament and with health and social care professionals, decision makers and families to inform and shine a light on best practice.

appg_groups.name: Erasmus
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Erasmus
appg_groups.purpose: To protect the cohesive exchange of staff, students and apprentices across borders. To work across parliament, the public and private sector to champion the opportunity for students and staff to study and work abroad, whilst ensuring that the UK remains an attractive place for international students.

appg_groups.name: Esports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Esports
appg_groups.purpose: To support esports.

appg_groups.name: Ethics and Sustainability in Fashion
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ethics and Sustainability in Fashion
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on both the ethical and environmental aspects of the fashion

appg_groups.name: Explosive Threats
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Explosive Threats
appg_groups.purpose: To consider the humanitarian consequences of explosive weapons and the assistance needed by victims of explosive violence. Through research and inquiry advocate for appropriate policy change, act as a focal point for debate and exchange of ideas, views and information.

appg_groups.name: Extraordinary Rendition
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Extraordinary Rendition
appg_groups.purpose: To examine extraordinary rendition and related issues, in response to allegations of British involvement in the extraordinary rendition programme.

appg_groups.name: Eye Health and Visual Impairment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eye Health and Visual Impairment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests and concerns of blind and partially sighted people.

appg_groups.name: Fair Business Banking
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fair Business Banking
appg_groups.purpose: To identify the failings within the financial service sector and work with industry, regulators and businesses to encourage and promote positive proposals for change.

appg_groups.name: Fairs and Showgrounds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fairs and Showgrounds
appg_groups.purpose: To help the industry in convening meetings with government departments who are introducing legislation to change existing legislation to the detriment of the fairs and showgrounds industry.

appg_groups.name: Fairtrade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fairtrade
appg_groups.purpose: To promote fairtrade within parliament; to deepen the relationship between local fairtrade organisations and parliamentarians and to further raise awareness of the importance of fairtrade.

appg_groups.name: Faith and Society
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Faith and Society
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the contribution to society by faith-based organisations, to identify best practice, and to promote understanding of the groups providing innovative solutions around the country.

appg_groups.name: Family Business
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Family Business
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between the UK family business sector and members of both houses.

appg_groups.name: Fatherhood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fatherhood
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG for Fatherhood promotes the wellbeing of children by ensuring that legal and policy frameworks keep up with the changing nature of family life and that legislation encourages active and responsible fatherhood.

appg_groups.name: Financial Education for Young People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Education for Young People
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and organisations to discuss the current provision of financial education in schools, further education and higher education, and ensure that all young people - regardless of background - are equipped to make informed financial decisions.

appg_groups.name: Financial Markets and Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Markets and Services
appg_groups.purpose: To provide parliamentarians with a unique forum for briefings and constructive debate on issues relating to the financial sector with senior city practitioners, advisors, economists and academics.

appg_groups.name: Financial Technology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Technology
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a progressive forum for parliamentarians to discuss the challenges and opportunities relating to the growth and competitiveness of the Financial Technology (FinTech) industry.

appg_groups.name: Fisheries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fisheries
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the UK fishing industry in Parliament, whilst exploring key questions for the future of fishing, processing, coastal communities and the marine environment.

appg_groups.name: a Fit and Healthy Childhood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on a Fit and Healthy Childhood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion and produce reports on all aspects of childhood health and wellbeing including obesity; to inform policy decisions and public debate relating to childhood and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Flood Prevention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Flood Prevention
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and further flood prevention across the UK, and minimise the impact of flooding on members of the public and British businesses.

appg_groups.name: Food and Drink
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Food and Drink
appg_groups.purpose: To act as the voice of food and drink in parliament. The Group serves to raise the profile of the food and drink industry, allowing MPs and Peers to explore issues affecting the industry through a programme of events, topical discussions, and site visits.

appg_groups.name: Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Football
appg_groups.purpose: To hold meetings for parliamentarians about football issues and raise matters of importance with the football authorities.

appg_groups.name: Football Supporters
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Football Supporters
appg_groups.purpose: To represent the interests of match-going football fans and to support the aims and objectives of the Football Supporters' Association.

appg_groups.name: Forestry and Tree Planting
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Forestry and Tree Planting
appg_groups.purpose: A successful forestry and wood-processing sector is positive for the economy, environment, biodiversity, recreation and health. But its future is under threat unless urgent action is taken. The sector needs a secure supply of timber and woodlands must be managed responsibly. The APPG will help tackle both of these issues.

appg_groups.name: Formula One
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Formula One
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport and industry of Formula One.

appg_groups.name: Foster Care Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Foster Care Work
appg_groups.purpose: This group aims to support foster care workers in their demand for a central register, workers' rights and collective bargaining.

appg_groups.name: the Fourth Industrial Revolution
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Fourth Industrial Revolution
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR) in Parliament and encourage government, parliament, academia and the private sector, and other stakeholders, to engage with 4IR-related issues.

appg_groups.name: Fracking
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fracking
appg_groups.purpose: To explore and debate legislation, policy, regulation and data regarding shale gas exploration and extraction in the UK and abroad.

appg_groups.name: Freeports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Freeports
appg_groups.purpose: To promote freeports as a vehicle for economic growth to benefit the national and local economies.

appg_groups.name: Frozen British Pensions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Frozen British Pensions
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentary supporters of the case to unfreeze British

appg_groups.name: Funerals and Bereavement
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Funerals and Bereavement
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of funeral and bereavement issues.

appg_groups.name: Further Education and Lifelong Learning
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Further Education and Lifelong Learning
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and develop the interests of further education, adult learning, skills sectors and to advise government ministers on matters of concern to those sectors.

appg_groups.name: Fusion Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fusion Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To inform the present status of research. The APPG will look at how to maximise UK industry income and export potential; how fusion can benefit from government investment; how fusion fits into the new research landscape under UKRI; and how to to fully exploit the synergies between fusion research and advanced nuclear fission technologies.

appg_groups.name: Future Generations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Future Generations
appg_groups.purpose: To create space for cross-party dialogue on combating short-termism and to identify ways to internalise concern for future generations into today's policy making.

appg_groups.name: Gambling Related Harm
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gambling Related Harm
appg_groups.purpose: To address the issues associated with gambling related harm.

appg_groups.name: General Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on General Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the objective - as set out by the British Government - of making the UK the best country in the world for General Aviation through inspiring both current and future generations to take up science, technology, engineering and mathematics, thereby creating high-tech jobs and growth in our economy.

appg_groups.name: Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness about Haemochromatosis (Iron Overload)

appg_groups.name: Geographically Protected Foods
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Geographically Protected Foods
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and protect the British foods that have shaped and built our culture and communities, and in particular to strengthen and defend the geographical indicator designation.

appg_groups.name: Global Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Education
appg_groups.purpose: To raise greater awareness of the factors affecting education in developing countries, and the government's obligations to help meet international goals for education for all. To work with all parties, international development organisations, education stakeholders (including unions) both nationally and internationally, to help secure a good quality education for all.

appg_groups.name: Global Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Health
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a parliamentary platform to identify and debate global health issues and concerns, raise the profile of global health within Parliament and government, and to prepare reports and make recommendations as appropriate.

appg_groups.name: Global Lesbian Gay Bisexual and Transgender LGBT Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT+) Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that global lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT+) issues are permanently part of the government’s agenda and the wider national conversation about human rights and equality, raised by well-briefed and motivated parliamentarians both nationally and internationally.

appg_groups.name: Global Security and Non-Proliferation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Security and Non-Proliferation
appg_groups.purpose: To exchange information and increase understanding of arms control, security and non-proliferation issues among British parliamentarians in particular, with the expectation that a more informed debate will have a positive impact on Britain's contribution to international disarmament and stability.

appg_groups.name: Greater Manchester
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Greater Manchester
appg_groups.purpose: To bring MPs and peers of all parties together with key leaders - the Mayor and those in local government, the private and voluntary sector, and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all the communities of Greater Manchester.

appg_groups.name: Green Deal Misselling
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Green Deal Misselling
appg_groups.purpose: To gather evidence from constituents who have been missold home improvements such as solar panels or insulation from rogue traders operating under the Green Deal. The group aims to find solutions for affected constituents and to prevent similar problems occurring under the new Green Deal.

appg_groups.name: Gypsies Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing Gypsy,

appg_groups.name: Hadrians Wall
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hadrian's Wall
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the 150 mile long UNESCO world heritage site and associated tourism outside of the north-east region; and to explore ways of increasing the importance of Hadrian's wall as an economic and cultural asset for every part of its route across the north-east and Cumbria.

appg_groups.name: Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with blood-borne viruses due to contaminated blood and blood products used in their healthcare treatment.

appg_groups.name: Hairdressing Barbering and Cosmetology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hairdressing, Barbering and Cosmetology
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the role of qualified, professional hairdressers and barbers, and facilitate an informed debate amongst parliamentarians regarding all aspects of the industry.

appg_groups.name: Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.purpose: To establish facts about the UK Hajj and Umrah sectors, promote and enable an industry led partnership with government to set minimum standards and good practice for Hajj and Umrah services sold in the UK, promote active and precautionary health and wellbeing, and have appropriate consular and other support services.

appg_groups.name: Healthy Homes and Buildings
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Healthy Homes and Buildings
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers of all parties together with policy makers, business leaders and industry experts to highlight the health and cost benefits which can be derived from constructing our buildings and homes to the highest levels of comfort, safety and energy efficiency.

appg_groups.name: Heathrow Expansion and Regional Connectivity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heathrow Expansion and Regional Connectivity
appg_groups.purpose: To examine issues relating to the proposed expansion of Heathrow Airport and the impacts on regional connectivity.

appg_groups.name: HIV and AIDS
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV and AIDS
appg_groups.purpose: To fight for the rights of people living with HIV and work to ensure all people living with HIV are able to access affordable medicines and a decent quality of life, free from stigma, discrimination and fear.

appg_groups.name: Hockey
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hockey
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of hockey in parliament, support the sport's growth and increase general participation in hockey.

appg_groups.name: Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.purpose: To promote holocaust memorial and education in parliament; and to support the establishment of a holocaust memorial and learning centre.

appg_groups.name: the Holy See
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
appg_groups.purpose: To foster friendly relations between the UK and the Holy See.

appg_groups.name: Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians of all parties with an interest in and commitment to ending homelessness; focus on all types of homelessness and differing solutions needed; make recommendations for the work of a wide range of departments who are key to ending homelessness.

appg_groups.name: Honour Based Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Honour Based Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and scrutinise issues relating to honour based abuse. To raise awareness of honour based abuse with a view to attempting to expose and eradicate such practices in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of adults and children living with terminal or life-limiting conditions, and their families and carers, in parliament; and to promote person-centred, evidence-based policies to improve end of life care in all settings, including hospices, hospitals, care homes, and in people's own homes.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.purpose: To examine key issues, opportunities and challenges facing the hospitality sector across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Social Mobility
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Social Mobility
appg_groups.purpose: To champion social housing providers that support communities to secure sustainable livelihoods. To examine evidence led insights into the role that government, housing providers and stakeholders can play to best support social housing tenants and communities to access long-term, rewarding employment.

appg_groups.name: Housing in the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing in the North
appg_groups.purpose: Provides a forum for parliamentarians to discuss and advance housing and related policy across the three northern regions and seeks to ensure the

appg_groups.name: Human Microbiome
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Microbiome
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the role of the human microbiome, especially of the gut, in physical and mental health and its potential to prevent many disorders and improve or slow others; inform debate about how this will save money for the Treasury and NHS; and enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

appg_groups.name: Hydrogen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hydrogen
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to engage with leading businesses and organisations that are working to enable the UK to meet its net-zero targets through implementation of hydrogen projects, and discuss policy options to support these.

appg_groups.name: Illicit Trade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Illicit Trade
appg_groups.purpose: To investigate and raise awareness of illicit trade in Britain, support closer working with parliamentarians to bring fresh impetus and ideas to tackling illicit trade and to highlight the impact on local businesses, high streets and communities.

appg_groups.name: Immigration Detention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Immigration Detention
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness in parliament about immigration detention in the UK and its impacts; to connect parliamentarians with relevant research, organisations and experts, including people with lived experience of detention; and to advocate for evidence-based policy reforms and the welfare of detainees.

appg_groups.name: Independent Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Independent Education
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss developments in the independent education sector, discuss issues facing the sector, highlight best practice, explore the wider contribution of the sector, share knowledge, and raise matters affecting the sector with government and sector leaders.

appg_groups.name: Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate informed discussions on issues concerning all Indian Traditional Sciences practised in the UK and abroad (Ayurveda, Yoga, Jyotish, Vastu, Unani and Sangeet) for inclusion into the NHS by providing a forum for cross-party parliamentarians, senior policy makers, academics, practitioners, leading community figures and stakeholders.

appg_groups.name: Industrial Heritage
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Heritage
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the industrial heritage of the United Kingdom and aim to help support British industrial heritage sites in a time of austerity.

appg_groups.name: Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

appg_groups.name: Infrastructure
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the importance of economic infrastructure in the UK amongst parliamentarians, decision makers and industry and to discuss how to ensure society gets the infrastructure it needs.

appg_groups.name: Inheritance and Intergenerational Fairness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inheritance and Intergenerational Fairness
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the impact the current system of inheritance tax is having on members of the public and identify areas of reform and improvement as well as keep under review the issue of intergenerational fairness and bring forward potential solutions to help solve it.

appg_groups.name: Intellectual Property
