appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intellectual Property
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property and the importance of its promotion and protection. The Group meets several times a year on topical issues relating to intellectual property.

appg_groups.name: Intelligent Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intelligent Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To develop among parliamentarians and key opinion formers a deeper understanding of energy efficiency and sustainable energy technologies and processes through parliamentary activity, public information and broad political debate.

appg_groups.name: International Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to address wildlife conservation and biodiversity issues affecting our planet including but not limited to ecosystem collapse, species extinctions, land degradation, invasive species, illegal fishing and other threats to the natural world.

appg_groups.name: International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and profile of international Freedom of Religion or Belief (Article 18, UDHR) as a human right among UK parliamentarians, the media, government and the general public. The group also seeks to increase the effectiveness of the UK's contribution to international institutions charged with enforcing this human right.

appg_groups.name: International Relations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Relations
appg_groups.purpose: To foster exemplary practice in international relations between parliamentary agencies, bodies and communities which promote benefits for humanity in a globally connected world.

appg_groups.name: International Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Students
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and 'soft power'; raise awareness of issues which affect international students and UK education; and provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, international education institutions and professionals and business leaders.

appg_groups.name: Islamic Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Islamic Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To give the Islamic finance industry a voice in parliament; to address issues as they arise such as Sukuk issuances, inclusivity, regulation and taxation whilst positioning the UK as the European hub of Islamic financial services, and also to play a wider role in promoting ethical finance.

appg_groups.name: Knife Crime and Violence Reduction
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Knife Crime and Violence Reduction
appg_groups.purpose: To evaluate policies and programmes aimed at reducing knife crime, gain better understanding of its root causes and the wider context of serious violence. To develop recommendations for new measures at both acute and preventative stages with a view to reducing levels of knife crime, and work with the cross-party Youth Violence Commission.

appg_groups.name: Land Value Capture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Land Value Capture
appg_groups.purpose: To work in partnership with national and local government departments, land developers and others to create a forum for parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to discuss and develop innovative proposals to capture increases in land value, for the public benefit.

appg_groups.name: Learning Disability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Learning Disability
appg_groups.purpose: To look at the issues facing people with a learning disability and their families. The group looks at the key issues of the day, across areas including health, social care, education, employment and benefits.

appg_groups.name: Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to leasehold and commonhold legislation and regulation. Reduce opportunities for exploitation and improve cladding. Review the leasehold property Tribunal as a low-cost forum for disputes and redress including leasehold insurance and service charges which fall outside FCA regulation. Meet with and monitor government departments and publicly funded bodies working on leasehold.

appg_groups.name: Legal Aid
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal Aid
appg_groups.purpose: The group brings together members of the House of Lords and the House of Commons with the singular purpose to discuss issues relating to legal aid. The group meets regularly when parliament is sitting to discuss topics that are important in the legal aid sector and to hear from those that work within it.

appg_groups.name: Life Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation.

appg_groups.name: Limits to Growth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Limits to Growth
appg_groups.purpose: To create the space for cross-party dialogue on environmental and social limits to growth; to assess the evidence for such limits, identify the risks and build support for appropriate responses; and to contribute to the international debate on redefining prosperity.

appg_groups.name: Listed Properties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
appg_groups.purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties, including tax and planning reform.

appg_groups.name: Liver Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Liver Health
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion of liver disease, including its major causes of viral hepatitis, alcohol and obesity, and to raise matters of concern with, and make representations to, government and other policy makers.

appg_groups.name: Local Authority Pension Funds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Authority Pension Funds
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss the issues and concerns of local authority pension funds and the work of the Local Authority Pension Fund Forum.

appg_groups.name: Local Democracy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Democracy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the virtues of exiting forms of first tier local authorities; to inform policy making and initiatives affecting first tier local authorities; and to stimulate debate on models of community governance.

appg_groups.name: Local Government
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

appg_groups.name: London
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
appg_groups.purpose: To promote London in the interests of all its people, places and businesses as a global city and powerhouse of the national economy.

appg_groups.name: Londons Planning and Built Environment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London's Planning and Built Environment
appg_groups.purpose: To debate the key issues facing the changing shape of London, from quality housing delivery, to the changing shape of the skyline, to affordability of living and work spaces, bringing together MPs and Peers from across the political parties to help shape a better city in a period of major growth.

appg_groups.name: Loneliness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Loneliness
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward cross-party work among parliamentarians to influence legislation and policy making in order to reduce loneliness and build on the work of the Jo Cox Commission on Loneliness.

appg_groups.name: Longevity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Longevity
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-disciplinary exchange on benefits of longevity (as opposed to 'problems' of ageing) within an ethical, citizen-centred framework to maximise the societal benefits of enabling healthier, more productive and purposeful lives. AI and data-driven solutions to increase healthspan and democratise access to the 'longevity dividend' for citizens will be a focus.

appg_groups.name: Looked After Children and Care Leavers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Looked After Children and Care Leavers
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the voice of care-experienced children and young people, in order to promote first-class government policy for children in care and care leavers.

appg_groups.name: Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians of the devastation that malaria and the neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) cause. Malaria and many of the NTDs are tractable disease. Suffering from malaria is avoidable. Malaria and many of the NTDs are treatable.

appg_groups.name: Maternity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maternity
appg_groups.purpose: To improve the quality of maternity services, raise awareness of the contribution maternity care can make to public health, and improve support during the first 1000 days of parenthood.

appg_groups.name: the Mayflower 400
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Mayflower 400
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the Mayflower 400.

appg_groups.name: Media Freedom
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Media Freedom
appg_groups.purpose: To promote media freedom in countries around the world and to strengthen the protection of journalists.

appg_groups.name: access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.purpose: To help secure appropriate access to medical cannabis on the NHS in its various forms including full plant extract containing both CBD and THC in formulations produced to a consistent high quality pharmaceutical grade and manufactured to GMP standard.

appg_groups.name: Medical Research
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Medical Research
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum and network for parliamentarians with an interest in medical research; to protect and strengthen the UK's world-leading medical research environment by facilitating collaboration between parliamentarians and medical research bodies and providing up-to-date information on developments in medical research, including aspects of public health, the ethics of research and the implications of research findings for society.

appg_groups.name: Access to Medicines and Medical Devices
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Access to Medicines and Medical Devices
appg_groups.purpose: To examine pricing, funding and wider access issues relating to the availability of medicines and medical technologies on the NHS in England.

appg_groups.name: Mental Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mental Health
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about all aspects of mental health.

appg_groups.name: Migration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Migration
appg_groups.purpose: To support the emergence of mainstream, progressive policy debate on migration in the UK parliament.

appg_groups.name: Mindfulness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mindfulness
appg_groups.purpose: To review research evidence, current best practice, extent and success of implementation, and potential developments in the application of mindfulness within a range of policy areas, and to develop policy recommendations for government based on these findings.

appg_groups.name: Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the structural problems within the criminal justice system which result in miscarriages of justice and to provide a forum from which to improve access to justice for those who have been wrongly convicted.

appg_groups.name: Modern Languages
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Languages
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the educational, skills-related, employment, competitive and cultural benefits of learning and using languages throughout the UK; to provide a parliamentary forum for information exchange and consultation; to encourage and support policies and action improving the take-up of languages in schools, further and higher education, in the workplace and in the community.

appg_groups.name: Mortgage Prisoners
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mortgage Prisoners
appg_groups.purpose: Solving the problems caused to mortgage prisoners in the UK by ensuring that all of them get a fair deal and fair treatment.

appg_groups.name: Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Motor Neurone Disease (MND) and to provide a forum for discussion of the issues facing people with MND and their families.

appg_groups.name: Motorsport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Motorsport
appg_groups.purpose: To support motorsport.

appg_groups.name: Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests of people affected by MS (Multiple Sclerosis).

appg_groups.name: Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.purpose: Raises awareness of all types of muscular dystrophy and neuromuscular conditions and promotes links between parliament, individuals and families affected by these muscle-wasting conditions, charities, scientists, health professionals and decision-makers.

appg_groups.name: Music
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a discussion forum between the music industry and parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis ME
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME)
appg_groups.purpose: To seek to improve health, social care, education and employment opportunities for ME sufferers and encourage biomedical research into the cause and treatment of ME.

appg_groups.name: Nature
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Nature
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for engaging and inspiring parliamentarians and others with the natural world, the major threats that it faces today, and the positives that come form a healthy natural environment.

appg_groups.name: Netball
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Netball
appg_groups.purpose: To support netball.

appg_groups.name: No Recourse to Public Funds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on No Recourse to Public Funds
appg_groups.purpose: To draw attention to the challenges faced by destitute migrants who have no recourse to public funds, with a particular focus on families and vulnerable adults, and to contribute to the development of policy and legislation in this area.

appg_groups.name: Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.purpose: A forum for parliamentarians to discuss civil nuclear energy on a cross-party basis.

appg_groups.name: Nursery Schools Nursery and Reception Classes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nursery Schools, Nursery and Reception Classes
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the role of high quality early childhood education in improving children's life chances; and to provide opportunities for parliamentarians to discuss early years policy issues with practitioners and researchers.

appg_groups.name: Nutrition for Growth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nutrition for Growth
appg_groups.purpose: To support and challenge the UK government to maintain their leadership on global nutrition and to make a significant pledge at the Nutrition for Growth summit in Tokyo 2020.

appg_groups.name: Obesity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Obesity
appg_groups.purpose: To call on the government to prioritise and drive increased investment and resource into both the prevention and treatment of obesity.

appg_groups.name: Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and promotion of issues relating to occupational safety and health; to provide information to members of both Houses of Parliament on topical issues; and to publish reports as and when necessary.

appg_groups.name: the Olympic and Paralympic Games
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Olympic and Paralympic Games
appg_groups.purpose: To be the cross-party voice in parliament promoting the Olympic and Paralympic Games and providing a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in the Olympic and Paralympic movements.

appg_groups.name: Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to electrical safety online and in domestic dwellings and to promote the prevention of accidents with electricity; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to their constituents on electrical safety; and to hold inquiries into policy issues and provide reports.

appg_groups.name: Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that Open Banking delivers maximum benefit and value to consumers, businesses and government; promotes effective competition and choice; reduces the cost of payments; supports innovation; and ensures that customers benefit from technological advances, and that new entrants and smaller providers can compete more fairly.

appg_groups.name: Opera
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Opera
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in opera; to further the appreciation of opera; and to provide a link between this art form and Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Oracy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Oracy
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG is committed to helping every child to be a confident communicator and find their voice, in order to succeed in school and life beyond. It aims to coordinate research, promote best practice and encourage the overarching principles of oracy in education and society at large.

appg_groups.name: Ovarian Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ovarian Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for MPs and peers to discuss ovarian cancer related issues; to raise areas of concern with government or other policy makers; to raise the profile of ovarian cancer within parliament and seek opportunities to help improve survival and quality of life for women.

appg_groups.name: the Packaging Manufacturing Industry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Packaging Manufacturing Industry.
appg_groups.purpose: To create a better understanding of the UK packaging manufacturing industry

appg_groups.name: the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of and help eliminate discrimination and persecution by the state and others; and to help develop an inclusive and tolerant Pakistan.

appg_groups.name: PANS and PANDAS
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on PANS and PANDAS
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness about PANS (Pediatric Acute-onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome) and PANDAS (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal Infections) and provide a forum in Parliament with a focus on current legislation, policy and evidence on treatment in order to improve detection, diagnosis and provision of treatment.

appg_groups.name: Parkinsons
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkinson's
appg_groups.purpose: The group aims to keep Parkinson's on the political agenda to ensure government initiatives and policies meet the needs of people with the condition and their families and carers.

appg_groups.name: Parkrun
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkrun
appg_groups.purpose: To support parkrun and improve public health.

appg_groups.name: Penal Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Penal Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To increase members' knowledge of penal affairs and to work through parliamentary channels to reform the penal system.

benefits_details.source: Prison Reform Trust is paid Secretariat 19,501-21,000 11/02/2020 12/02/2020

appg_groups.name: Pensions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pensions
appg_groups.purpose: To develop and encourage pensions arrangements in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Personalised Medicine
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Personalised Medicine
appg_groups.purpose: Provides a forum to explore how the UK can better use innovative science and technology for more personalised and sustainable healthcare. Seeks to help accelerate the health benefits of national investment and excellence in genomics and biomedical science.

appg_groups.name: Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.purpose: To further understanding of the role of philanthropy, giving and social investment in parliament, and to act as a discussion forum for politicians, philanthropists, social investors and experts to develop policy to improve and increase the amount of giving and social investment to good causes in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Photography
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Photography
appg_groups.purpose: To promote interest in photography.

appg_groups.name: Photonics and Quantum
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Photonics and Quantum
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the photonics industry and recognise the impact it makes on the UK economy and its potential for future economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Policing and Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Policing and Security
appg_groups.purpose: To promote better understanding of policing and security issues amongst both Houses of Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Population Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Population, Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure the full implementation of the International Conference on Population and Development's programme of Action with specific reference to stabilisation of the world's population through choice and ensuring sustainable development in the UK and abroad.

appg_groups.name: Post Offices
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Post Offices
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the important economic and social contribution post offices and post masters make; to ensure their position as a vital public service; and to provide input into the areas of public policy which affect the post office.

appg_groups.name: Post-Brexit Funding for Nations Regions and Local Areas
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Post-Brexit Funding for Nations, Regions and Local Areas
appg_groups.purpose: The EU is the largest financial contributor to UK regional development. After Brexit the government will establish a UK Shared Prosperity Fund. The APPG intends to shape thinking and engage in the details of the fund and new system of regional funding and policies after Brexit.

appg_groups.name: Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: To provide awareness of the impact of poverty, its causes and consequences, and to encourage the spread of good practice to alleviate and eliminate it.

benefits_details.source: Child Poverty Action group Joint Secretariat 3,001-4,500 12/02/2020 20/02/2020

appg_groups.name: Premature and Sick Babies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Premature and Sick Babies
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the issues affecting the parents of premature and sick babies, to create practical action which secures the best quality of life for affected families, and to champion policies which increase the chance of a positive outcome for these babies.

appg_groups.name: the Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative
appg_groups.purpose: To continue the work carried out by the previous APPG on PSVI (Prevention of Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative) and promote the cause through supporting the conference and engaging with outside bodies to support this initiative.

appg_groups.name: Professional Sales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Professional Sales
appg_groups.purpose: To improve recognition by parliament and industry of the importance of sales and its impact on the UK economy; to promote and advance sales as a profession; to boost the success of British industry, especially in international trade.

appg_groups.name: Publishing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Publishing
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the value of high quality publishing to UK society, culture and the economy. To foster a better understanding among parliamentarians about publishers, booksellers and associated fields, all of whom contribute to a world-leading publishing sector.

appg_groups.name: Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.purpose: To keep parliamentarians and the government up to date with issues in horseracing and bloodstock; to foster good relations with the various parts of horseracing, and between them; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: Radiotherapy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Radiotherapy
appg_groups.purpose: To provide an effective voice for radiotherapy and improve access to radiotherapy for cancer patients, ensuring no-one has to travel more than 45 minutes to their nearest radiotherapy unit. To ensure radiotherapy receives increased funding so that patients are allowed to have the best radiotherapy for their individual cancer.

appg_groups.name: Rail in the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rail in the North
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss rail services in the North of England.

appg_groups.name: Rail in Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rail in Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues related to the rail network and industry in Wales. To conduct specific inquiries, and to hear directly from representatives of the rail industry.

appg_groups.name: Refugees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Refugees
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to refugees, both in the UK and abroad, and to promote the welfare of refugees.

appg_groups.name: Religion in the Media
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religion in the Media
appg_groups.purpose: To improve religious literacy in media and politics and to provide a platform where the regulatory, commercial and cultural factors which influence depictions of faith can be discussed.

appg_groups.name: Religious Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religious Education
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a medium through which parliamentarians and organisations with an interest in religious education can discuss the current provision of religious education, press for continuous improvement, promote public understanding and advocate rigorous education for every young person in religious and non- religious world views.

appg_groups.name: Respiratory Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Respiratory Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the importance of respiratory health and to promote effective policy for improving treatments and outcomes for respiratory illnesses.

appg_groups.name: Retail Crime
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Retail Crime
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the cost of retail crime to the high street (£600m a year), improve understanding of how this type of crime affects small businesses and what impact incidents of retail crime will have an effect on our high streets if left unchecked.

appg_groups.name: Reuniting Britain Post-Brexit
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Reuniting Britain Post-Brexit
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward a cross-party conversation on policy solutions to help heal and bridge the divisions exposed by the EU referendum. More specifically, the APPG will focus on three core themes, reflecting the three main fractures that the EU referendum exposed: intergenerational division and unfairness in the 21st century; the difference of views between graduates and non-graduates; and inequality between young citizens in cities on the one hand and in towns and rural areas on the other.

appg_groups.name: Roadside Rescue and Recovery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Roadside Rescue and Recovery
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the issues affecting the roadside rescue and recovery industry, including the dangers workers in the industry face in the performance of their work, the protection afforded to them by government regulations, and the need to collect specific data on accidents involving recovery workers.

appg_groups.name: the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.purpose: In recognising the persecution, murder and other atrocities committed against the Rohingya, the group will work towards protecting and enhancing the human rights and status of the Rohingya, and will assess and scrutinise any repatriation agreement made between Bangladesh and Myanmar.

appg_groups.name: Rowing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rowing
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of rowing.

appg_groups.name: Rugby League
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rugby League
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of rugby league football.

appg_groups.name: Rural Business and the Rural Powerhouse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rural Business and the Rural Powerhouse
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the areas that would reduce the productivity gap between urban and rural areas.

appg_groups.name: Rural Health and Social Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Health and Social Care
appg_groups.purpose: To develop evidence-based policy recommendations for the government on the rural health (both mental and physical) and social care economy of England. Current models are not suited to rural areas with sparse populations and a disproportionate number of over 85s with comorbidities including isolation and other mental health problems.

appg_groups.name: Rural Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Services
appg_groups.purpose: To promote a debate on the provision of rural services and to issue periodic reports.

appg_groups.name: Safeguarding in Faith Settings
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Safeguarding in Faith Settings
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on safeguarding concerns relevant to any community of faith, belief or religion. The APPG is attempting to raise awareness and improve policy and practice in relation to safeguarding in faith settings and by encouraging both the opportunity and responsibility of those faith groups and communities in creating safe places for all.

appg_groups.name: School Food
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on School Food
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a parliamentary forum for the discussion of all matters of food education in schools and other settings; to push the issue of school food up the political agenda on a cross-party basis; and to provide a forum through which external organisations concerned in matters related to school food, child hunger and food education can share best practice and establish shared positions and priorities.

appg_groups.name: Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and stakeholders to debate and highlight the value of science and technology in agriculture.

appg_groups.name: Scotch Whisky
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Scotch Whisky
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between representatives of the Scotch Whisky industry and MPs.

appg_groups.name: Scottish Sport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Scottish Sport
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and advance issues of importance to Scottish sport by complementing the work of the Scottish government and all Scottish governing bodies.

appg_groups.name: Sepsis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sepsis
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a medium through which parliamentarians, organisations and those affected by Sepsis can discuss the current provision for the illness, promote public understanding and advocate for simple, timely interventions to be implemented as standard across the NHS.

appg_groups.name: Shipbuilding and Ship Repair
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Shipbuilding and Ship Repair
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure UK sovereign defence capability in the maritime sphere, and to ensure that UK companies and supply chains compete on a level playing field.

appg_groups.name: Shooting and Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Shooting and Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians and to act as a forum for the exchange of views on shooting and conservation.

appg_groups.name: the Short Lets Sector
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Short Lets Sector
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, short-let platforms, local authorities and other affected sectors to discuss issues arising from the growing short- lets market; and to advise on ways in which to optimise the positive contributions of this sector and avoid undesired impacts.

appg_groups.name: Single Parent Families
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Single Parent Families
appg_groups.purpose: To collaborate across the political spectrum to campaign against legislative loopholes that disadvantage single parents, and for positive representation of

appg_groups.name: Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the interests of institutions that deliver sixth form education, and to advise government on the challenges facing 16 to18 education.

appg_groups.name: Skills and Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Skills and Employment
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-party coalition of parliamentarians devoted to raising the profile of skills and employment policy. Brings together Parliament, employers, and the skills sector to ensure that skills policy promotes social mobility, lifelong learning opportunities and local economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of small and micro business issues in parliament.

appg_groups.name: SME Small and Medium-sized Enterprises House Builders
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) House Builders
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the operations of SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) house builders in the UK; discover and highlight best practice; review the regulatory environment affecting the market, looking at ways of improving the delivery of new homes, and making recommendations on how Parliament can improve regulation to deliver more effective building of homes by SMEs.

appg_groups.name: Smoking and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Smoking and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To monitor and discuss the health and social effects of smoking; to review potential changes to existing legislation to reduce levels of smoking; to assess the latest medical techniques to assist in smoking cessation; and to act as a resource for the group's members on all issues relating to smoking and public health.

appg_groups.name: Snooker
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Snooker
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of snooker.

appg_groups.name: Social Enterprise
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Enterprise
appg_groups.purpose: To showcase social enterprises and discuss issues important to the social enterprise sector.

appg_groups.name: Social Integration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Integration
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward a cross-party conversation on policy solutions to break down barriers to integration and create opportunities for people from all walks of life to connect with each other and build bonds of trust.

appg_groups.name: Social Media
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Media
appg_groups.purpose: To drive policy change that mitigates the negatives and maximises the positives of social media for young people.

appg_groups.name: Social Mobility
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Mobility
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and evaluate key issues and indicators of social mobility and barriers to it. To hold seminars and meetings to present and highlight the latest research on social mobility.

appg_groups.name: Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians and social scientists and by doing so demonstrate the relevance and value of social science research.

appg_groups.name: the great South West
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the great South West
appg_groups.purpose: The All-Party Parliamentary Group for the South West seeks to promote the economic and social advancement of the South West region as a great place to live, work and do business.

benefits_details.source: JBP Associates is paid by Secretariat 15,001-16,500 11/02/2020 12/02/2020

appg_groups.name: South Western Railway
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on South Western Railway
appg_groups.purpose: To champion the needs of constituents and passengers who travel on the railway that operates in/out of London Waterloo and the geographical area that extends from London Waterloo to Portsmouth, Weymouth, Exeter, Bristol and Reading, the network within these points and connecting lines.

appg_groups.name: Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate a continuing discussion on how the UK can sustain a sovereign defence manufacturing capability.

appg_groups.name: Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.purpose: To support special schools and SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities) provision in mainstream school and college settings.

appg_groups.name: Speech and Language Difficulties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Speech and Language Difficulties
appg_groups.purpose: To make parliament aware that the ability to communicate is a crucial life skill for all; to increase awareness about the impact communication difficulties have on other people's lives; to highlight the importance of early identification and intervention; and to press for increased provision of speech and language therapy.

appg_groups.name: Sport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sport
appg_groups.purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice for sport in parliament and to promote the wider societal benefits of sport and physical activity in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Sport Modern Slavery and Human Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sport, Modern Slavery and Human Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To find solutions to pressing human rights problems affecting large-scale sporting events around the world, with a focus on three specific areas: the human rights impacts of the cycle of mega-sporting events, the impacts of the UK Modern Slavery Act on professional sports companies, and discrimination in sport in all its forms.

appg_groups.name: Srebrenica
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Srebrenica
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage the commemoration of the victims of Srebrenica on the internationally recognised day of 11th July and raise awareness of the genocide amongst communities in the UK; and use the lessons of Srebrenica to tackle hatred and prejudice to hep build a safer, stronger and more cohesive society.

appg_groups.name: State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum in which to hold the government to account on the issue of transitional arrangements to compensate 1950's-born women who are affected by changes to the state pension age and to campaign on issues around the state pension age.

appg_groups.name: Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure a fair deal for the UK steel and metal related industries by liaising with and lobbying the government, to raise the profile of cultural, environmental and social issues in the industry and its communities, and to research and develop policies which will promote thriving steel and cast metal industries in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Stem Cell Transplantation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stem Cell Transplantation
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about the use of stem cell transplantation in saving lives; to facilitate debate and scrutiny on the collection and use of adult stem cells and umbilical cord blood in the UK; and to promote the expansion of stem cell donation in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Students
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for all parliamentarians to develop greater understanding of the range of issues affecting students in further and higher education. To ensure that student views and experiences are heard in Parliament, facilitate interaction between students and MPs and Peers, and ensure education policy takes account of student views.

appg_groups.name: Surrogacy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Surrogacy
appg_groups.purpose: To fully review our surrogacy laws, encourage and promote debate on the issues, facilitate further research into how surrogacy is conducted, bring the law into line with modern social realities, and encourage domestic surrogacy in the first instance.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote support and knowledge in parliament of the aviation industry's efforts to achieve sustainability, specifically their goal of net zero carbon emissions by 2050 in line with the government's overall target for the UK.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sustainable Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians to understand more about sustainable finance. To bring together policy makers, industry experts, academics and practitioners to build knowledge and political consensus for the changes required in the finance sector to help reach net zero.

appg_groups.name: Swimming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Swimming
appg_groups.purpose: To promote swimming and other aquatic disciplines and to highlight the importance of swimming and water safety in schools.

appg_groups.name: Tamils
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tamils
appg_groups.purpose: To promote in Parliament peace with justice and dignity for Tamils in the Island of Sri Lanka and advance their development so as to recognise their legitimate socio-political aspirations.

appg_groups.name: Taxation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxation
appg_groups.purpose: To look at and understand tax policy and taxation on all levels including simplification and digitalisation, EU Brexit and its impact on the UK’s taxation system, and international taxation. To work in partnership with HM Treasury to create a 'safe space' for Parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to meet, discuss and develop innovative proposals to reform, simplify and make the UK’s taxation system fairer.

appg_groups.name: Taxis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxis
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the interests of the taxi trade in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Tennis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tennis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of tennis, and to enable MPs and peers to play tennis matches together and compete with outside tennis teams.

appg_groups.name: Terminal Illness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Terminal Illness
appg_groups.purpose: Raises awareness of issues around terminal illness in parliament. Promotes links between parliament, individuals and families affected, charities, scientists, health professionals and decision makers. Includes MPs from across the political spectrum who are keen to discuss, improve and share knowledge of end of life care.

appg_groups.name: Tackling Terrorism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tackling Terrorism
appg_groups.purpose: To evaluate and develop policies on tackling terrorism.

appg_groups.name: Textiles and Fashion
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Textiles and Fashion
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the significance of the UK textile and fashion industry across the world, supporting its development as an integral part of our economy.

appg_groups.name: Theatre
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Theatre
appg_groups.purpose: To support the resilience and relevance of theatre in the UK for audiences, society and the industry. To identify and debate potential opportunities and issues for theatre in the UK. To support parliamentarians' understanding of the theatre and performing arts industry at a national and local level.

benefits_details.source: Society of London Theatre Joint Secretariat 9,001-10,500 14/01/2020 16/01/2020

appg_groups.name: Trade out of Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trade out of Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: Organises seminars, inquiries, research and education campaigns to raise awareness in Parliament on removing barriers to trade and using trade as an engine for development in poor countries. The APPG aims to help developing countries achieve inclusive growth and prosperity through trade and investment.

appg_groups.name: Trailer and Towing Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trailer and Towing Safety
appg_groups.purpose: Brings together parliamentarians, industry representatives and consumer groups to discuss and raise awareness of trailer and towing safety in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focus for UK parliamentary cross-party support for a comprehensive transatlantic trade and investment agreement; to contribute to greater public debate and understanding of potential benefits and drawbacks for British consumers, workers and businesses; to strengthen parliamentary and public scrutiny to help secure a successful agreement.

appg_groups.name: Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.purpose: To accelerate the progress towards ending the TB epidemic.

appg_groups.name: the Union
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Union
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, social, cultural and constitutional benefits of the union of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; To foster good relations between the four countries of the UK and their devolved administrations; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development and monitor their implementation.

appg_groups.name: Universal Credit
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Universal Credit
appg_groups.purpose: To monitor Universal Credit as it is rolled out; to share best practice in supporting constituents; and to make recommendations to government to improve policy.

appg_groups.name: Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.purpose: Raising the political profile of the importance of routine vaccinations, ensuring equitable access to vaccines for everyone, no matter where they live.

appg_groups.name: Valproate and other Anti-Epileptic Drugs in Pregnancy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Valproate and other Anti-Epileptic Drugs in Pregnancy
appg_groups.purpose: To raise government awareness of the dangers of Valproate and other anti- epileptic drugs in pregnancy and to support and advocate for those harmed by the drugs taken by the mother in pregnancy.

appg_groups.name: Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of vascular and venous disease and to encourage actions to promote a greater priority for its prevention and treatment; to encourage research into the causes of vascular and venous disease; to advance excellence and innovation in vascular and venous disease and related cardiovascular conditions.

appg_groups.name: Vegetarianism and Veganism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vegetarianism and Veganism
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for discussing issues around vegetarianism and veganism. These include vegan and vegetarian rights and catering, public health, environmental issues and animal rights.

appg_groups.name: Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.purpose: To work with the games and interactive entertainment industry, including with its trade body UK Interactive Entertainment, to promote the industry's economic, technological and cultural contributions within Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Votes at 16
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Votes at 16
appg_groups.purpose: To strengthen the cross-party case for extending the franchise to 16- and 17- year-olds by acting as a discussion forum and active campaigning group for politicians, the youth sector and experts to develop policy and research.

appg_groups.name: War Heritage
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on War Heritage
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the protection, conservation and interpretation of war graves, war memorials and battlefield sites.

appg_groups.name: the West Midlands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the West Midlands
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for cross-party parliamentarians and interested stakeholders from the West Midlands, to monitor policy and maintain a dialogue with government, business, councils and organisations, and to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all its local communities.

appg_groups.name: Whistleblowing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Whistleblowing
appg_groups.purpose: Whistleblowers are a vital element of a transparent society. In 1998 the Public Interest Disclosure Act was introduced to protect employees who speak out. In the face of many recent scandals the APPG is looking at the effectiveness of this legislation and how it might be improved.

appg_groups.name: Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and inform on the economic and commercial benefits of the UK wine and spirit trade; to inform and stimulate debate on issues of relevance to the trade and to consumers, including English wine and British spirits; and to introduce parliamentarians to members of the trade from their constituencies.

appg_groups.name: Wine of Great Britain
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Wine of Great Britain
appg_groups.purpose: To identify how Whitehall departments, in conjunction with Members of the Commons and Lords, can support producers of wine from grapes grown across the UK, to ensure that relevant legislation and regulations, combined with innovative support and trade deals can deliver a profitable sector for the domestic and export markets.

appg_groups.name: Women and Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women and Work
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion around women and work.

appg_groups.name: Women in Parliament
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in Parliament
appg_groups.purpose: Brings together MPs and peers to discuss and campaign for increasing the number of women in parliament in all parties and, to support women in parliament and those standing for public office.

appg_groups.name: Women in the Penal System
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in the Penal System
appg_groups.purpose: To increase the knowledge and awareness of issues around women in the penal system as well as push for the full implementation of the Corston Report recommendations.

appg_groups.name: Women in Transport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in Transport
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss and overcome the under-representation of women in transport by promoting best practice examples of employers leading the way in gender diversifying their workforce.

appg_groups.name: Women Peace and Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women, Peace and Security
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and analysis of issues relating to the Women, Peace and Security agenda. To bring together parliamentarians, policymakers, academia and civil society to scrutinise and strengthen the UK government's implementation of commitments to women and girls' rights in fragile and conflict-affected states.

appg_groups.name: Womens Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Football
appg_groups.purpose: To promote women's football.

appg_groups.name: Womens Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Health
appg_groups.purpose: To empower women to ensure that they can make an informed choice about the best treatment for them and that they are treated with dignity and respect.

appg_groups.name: Woods and Trees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Woods and Trees
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the UK's woods and trees and to discuss the steps necessary to protect, restore and expand them in a time of climate and nature crises.

appg_groups.name: Working at Height
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Working at Height
appg_groups.purpose: Falls from height and falling objects from height account for the highest number of preventable fatalities and injuries across all sectors in UK industry. The APPG will seek to understand the root causes and propose effective, sensible measures to reduce this toll and send people safely home from work.

appg_groups.name: Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.purpose: To bring MPs of all parties together with key leaders - those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all local communities and economies.

appg_groups.name: Young Peoples Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Young People's Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of issues related to the mental, social and physical health of young people

appg_groups.name: Youth Action against Climate Change
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Action against Climate Change
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for young people to engage with parliamentarians on issues related to climate change; to promote horizontal inclusion of young people concerned with the issue related to climate change; to raise the profile of climate change issues affecting constituencies across UK; to encourage behavioural change on local and global levels; to inform interactions among parliamentarians, youth, NGOs, and experts.

appg_groups.name: Youth Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of issues which affect and concern young people; to encourage dialogue between parliamentarians, young people and youth services; and to encourage a co-ordinated and coherent approach to policy making on youth affairs.

benefits_details.source: YMCA England and Wales Joint Secretariat 1,501-3,000 29/01/2020 19/02/2020
